content.description: This route requires 4 or 5 draws for the start then a small assortment of cams up to 3" take you to an anchor. The crux is at the beginning to the second bolt. Clipping the first bolt requires a fair amount of balance, and the landing is bad, don't blow it. It is about the only moves that give thought on this climb.
content.protection: 4-5 draws and gear in the 1"-3" range. The rappel anchor might be webbing and maybe some extension slings?
content.location:
It is about 15' to the left of

Darkness Till Dawn

.

content.description: On the right (eastern) wall, this is the obvious, beautiful arete in the center of the wall. Fun moves and great views will both keep you on your game.
content.location: From the western wall, head east and slightly down and around house boulders and back up to base of the eastern wall. Right of this climb is More Smiles for the Mile, 5.9, bolts & finger/hand gear.

content.description: Climb up a wide hand splitter to the first anchor left of the crack. Clip a long runner or two to the first anchor (5.10), and traverse left into the thin finger crack in a shallow corner, then take it to the second anchor (5.11). The .10 section is about 50' long, and the .11 section is the rest. This definitely can be done as one pitch. Moving to and past the first anchor is pretty tough.
content.protection: Small cams to start then #3 Camalots and perhaps a #3.5 Tech Friend for the first ... then several cams in the red Alien size to hit the .11 section. There are cold shuts at the first and webbing I think at the second anchor.
content.location:
This is right of

Coalition Of The Drilling

by about 60'. It is an obvious splitter.

content.description: Climb over five or six bolts that cover slabby moves dispersed with the welcomed patina edges. There is enough slab to slow you down and think for sure!
content.protection: 5-6 draws. The anchor may need webbing.
content.location:
This is the first route left of

S.S.S.S.

by roughly 40'.

content.description: On the center of the left (western) wall, climb 5.9 up and left into a slot/groove, then go up the tight tips double seams/cracks to the anchor. This is fun and will challenge your small cam placing skills.
content.protection: Small hands to tips. There are no bolts on this climb other than the anchors.
content.location: It is just left of, and shares start with, the 5.8 Black Walk that goes up and right past several bolts to thin gear.

content.description: On left (western) wall, this is the 2nd climb from left. Start at obvious overhanging 6" roof crack with bolts on wall to right. Layback easily past offwidth section and move up into a shallow dihedral, clipping bolts at great stances. It has a desperate crux at the top just before anchors. This is great quality and is well-protected!
content.location: This climb is just right of Stacked Blocks, 5.9. Climb bolts to a wide, blocky crack.

content.description: This thin, bolted face with crispy edges will keep your fingertips and toes aching for the anchors. It is challenging and balancy.
content.location:
It is 2 climbs right of the

Sizzlin' Summer...

arete.

content.description:
Start on

Doobieous Deliverance

for one or two gear placements, then trend right up a flake to the first bolt of Black Walk. Continue trending right for the most part up a hard-to-read, sustained, and slabby line with s-p-a-c-e-d bolts. Get your head right, it is not a beginner 5.8 climb. The climb moves more to the right than you would expect, even while on the route.
content.protection:
Gear to start on

D.D.

then draws. The old guide makes it sound like gear is up higher, but I didn't remember any. You better bring a couple thin cams if my memory is incorrect. The anchors might be webbing.
content.location:
Do the same start as

Doobieous Deliverance

, then clip the bolts to the right.
